item.title: 白宫担心经济数据延迟的影响
item.description: 白宫担心政府长期停摆可能会进一步推迟关键经济数据的发布，原定于周五发布的就业报告被推迟了。【原文：The White House is concerned that a prolonged government shutdown could further delay the release of key economic data the jobs report scheduled for Friday was held back.】

item.title: 贬值 "交易刺激风险反弹，比特币逼近历史纪录
item.description: 比特币接近历史最高点，因为围绕美国政府关门的更广泛的风险反弹提振了世界上最大的加密货币。【原文：Bitcoin approached its all-time high as a broader risk rally around the US government shutdown buoyed the world’s largest cryptocurrency.】

item.title: 尽管面临更大供应风险，维托尔仍大力投资北海石油项目
item.description: 维托尔集团在北海原油上建立了大量头寸，表明尽管有迹象表明全球供应即将增加，但该集团仍看好基准价格。【原文：Vitol Group has built up a significant position in North Sea crude, indicating a bullish bet on benchmark prices despite signs of a looming increase in global supplies.】

item.title: 美国联邦存款保险公司（FDIC）将通过新计划加入特朗普的去银行化之争
item.description: 美国监管机构将于下周公布一项针对官员如何审查银行风险的计划，此前美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）已着手控制他所认为的出于政治原因关闭客户账户的行为。【原文：US regulators are set to unveil a plan next week targeting how officials scrutinize banks’ risk, after President Donald Trump moved to rein in what he sees as the closing of customer accounts for political reasons.】

item.title: 欧佩克关注的石油曲线在供应会议召开前夕出现下挫
item.description: 自欧佩克+于四月份开始增加供应以来，该组织一直从一个关键的石油指标中获得保证：价格曲线。随着欧佩克+准备在本周末召开会议，这一指标正在动摇。【原文：Ever since OPEC+ started ramping up supplies in April, the group has drawn reassurance from one key oil indicator: the price curve. As it prepares to meet this weekend, that gauge is faltering.】

item.title: 贝森特引发混乱，当地人加剧阿根廷债券波动
item.description: 在过去两周里，阿根廷债券因交易屏幕上出现的每一条头条新闻而暴涨或暴跌，波动狂潮一浪高过一浪。一些投资者认为，在许多波动背后都有本地交易商的身影，因为外国人在紧紧抓住不放。【原文：Argentine bonds have soared or tumbled on every headline that has peppered trading screens over the past two weeks in a frenzy of volatility. Some investors see local traders behind many of the moves as foreigners hold tight.】

item.title: 欧洲央行施纳贝尔称金融市场可能正变得自满
item.description: 欧洲中央银行执行委员伊莎贝尔-施纳贝尔说，投资者和其他金融市场参与者可能低估了风险。【原文：European Central Bank Executive member Isabel Schnabel said that investor and other financial market participants are possibly underestimating risks.】

item.title: 中国拒绝购买美国大豆。这对美国农民意味着什么？
item.description: 大豆已成为中美贸易争端的最新热点。作为全球最大的大豆买家，中国本季没有从美国农民手中预订任何一批大豆。这很不寻常，而且对依赖中国购买其大部分作物的美国种植者来说代价高昂。中国转而依赖南美供应商，而美国农民则面临着粮仓满溢和价格持平的问题。【原文：Soybeans have become the latest flashpoint in the trade dispute between China and the US. China, the world’s largest buyer of the crop, hasn’t booked a single shipment from US farmers this season. That’s unusual — and costly for US growers, who depend on China to buy a big share of their crop. China is instead relying on South American suppliers, while US farmers face overflowing bins and flat prices.】

item.title: 市场 "盲目 "停摆，国债本周上涨
item.description: 国债收益率将创下一个月来的最大跌幅，原因是美国政府关门延误了重要的经济报告，并让投资者质疑美联储将如何采取下一步行动。【原文：Treasuries yields were poised for their biggest declines in a month, as the US government shutdown delayed key economic reports and left investors questioning how the Federal Reserve will navigate its next moves.】

item.title: 人工智能反弹刺激 FOMO，高盛客户看涨情绪为 10 个月来最高
item.description: 高盛集团（Goldman Sachs Group Inc.【原文：Excitement over the artificial intelligence trade is stoking investor bullishness on US stocks while also raising the risks of a rapid selloff, according to Goldman Sachs Group Inc.’s trading desk.】

item.title: 合并套利交易者如何计划在 EA 收购中套现
item.description: 电子艺界公司（Electronic Arts Inc. ）同意将自己出售给一群投资者，这将是有史以来最大的杠杆收购交易，为华尔街的一个角落--合并套利--创造了一个诱人的赚钱机会。套利者被称为 "套利者"（arbs），他们试图从股票目前的交易价格与买方同意支付的价格之间的差距中获利。【原文：The agreement by Electronic Arts Inc. to sell itself to a group of investors — a deal that would be the largest leveraged buyout on record — has created an attractive money-making opportunity in a corner of Wall Street known as merger arbitrage. Arbitrageurs, known as arbs, seek to profit from the gap between where a stock trades today and the price a buyer has agreed to pay.】

item.title: 欧佩克+"成员国努力就下一次增加供应的规模达成共识
item.description: 与会代表表示，欧佩克+国家正努力就下月如何调整石油产量达成共识，可能会小幅或更大幅度地增加供应量。【原文：OPEC+ nations are trying to reach consensus on how to adjust their oil production next month, with either a modest or more substantial supply increase possible, delegates said.】

item.title: 如果停摆不延长，美国股市也能渡过难关：市场脉搏
item.description: 最新的《市场脉搏》调查显示，美国政府关门必须持续一个多月，美股的牛市才能刹车。【原文：The US government shutdown would have to last over a month for the bull run in US stocks to hit the brakes, the latest Markets Pulse survey showed.】

item.title: EQT 的 EdgeConnex 公司利用摩根士丹利发行数据中心债务
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，EQT 支持的数据中心运营商 EdgeConnex Inc 已指定摩根士丹利为其不断增长的欧洲业务探索融资方案。【原文：EQT-backed data center operator EdgeConnex Inc has appointed Morgan Stanley to explore financing options for its growing European activities, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 投资者押注长期投资，贝莱德债券 ETF 失去头把交椅
item.description: 在快速发展的市政债券交易所交易基金领域，竞争日趋白热化。【原文：Competition is heating up in the rapidly growing arena of municipal-bond exchange-traded funds.】

item.title: 拉加德称欧洲央行在利率问题上做了大量工作，目前情况 "良好
item.description: 欧洲中央银行行长克里斯蒂娜-拉加德（Christine Lagarde）表示，她对目前的政策设定感到满意，因为欧元区的通胀率仍大致保持稳定。【原文：European Central Bank President Christine Lagarde suggested that she’s comfortable with the current policy settings as inflation in the euro area remains broadly stable.】

item.title: 欧洲议会要求加快逐步淘汰俄罗斯石油和天然气
item.description: 欧洲议会正在考虑加快逐步停止进口俄罗斯石油和天然气，以彻底断绝与该地区前头号能源供应国的关系。【原文：The European Parliament is considering accelerating a phaseout of Russian oil and gas imports in a bid to sever ties definitively with the region’s former top energy supplier.】

item.title: 海上石油供应量飙升至 2023 年以来最高点，显示供应量不断增加
item.description: 在世界各大洋上航行的油轮上的石油数量攀升至两年多来的最高水平，这是全球石油供应量在可能出现供过于求之前膨胀的最新迹象。【原文：The amount of oil on tankers plowing the world’s oceans climbed to the highest in more than two years, the latest indication of swelling global volumes ahead of a likely period of oversupply.】

item.title: 高盛分析：美国初请失业金人数增至22.4万
item.description: 根据高盛集团（Goldman Sachs Group Inc.【原文：Applications for US unemployment benefits edged up last week, according to a Goldman Sachs Group Inc. analysis of state-level filings released during the federal government shutdown.】

item.title: UnitedHealth 股东要求分设董事长和首席执行官职位
item.description: 联合健康集团（UnitedHealth Group Inc. ）的一名股东提交了一份提案，要求独立董事会主席有别于首席执行官。【原文：A UnitedHealth Group Inc. shareholder has filed a proposal to require an independent board chair distinct from the chief executive officer, roles that were combined when Stephen Hemsley returned to lead the company this year.】

item.title: 国际货币基金组织称重大经济风险与产业政策有关
item.description: 国际货币基金组织（International Monetary Fund）周五警告说，鉴于附带的重大经济风险，各国政府需要谨慎对待如何利用产业政策来支持包括能源在内的关键部门。【原文：Governments need to be careful about how they lean on industrial policy to support key sectors including energy given the significant economic risks attached, the International Monetary Fund warned on Friday.】

item.title: 美国服务业指数下降，商业活动为 2020 年以来最弱
item.description: 9 月份，美国服务业停滞不前，商业活动自大流行病以来首次出现萎缩，订单几乎没有增加。【原文：The US service sector stalled in September as business activity shrank for the first time since the pandemic and orders barely expanded.】

item.title: 千禧年在迪拜为专注于大宗商品的新办公室招聘员工
item.description: 据一位熟悉内情的人士透露，伊兹-英格兰德（Izzy Englander）旗下价值 790 亿美元的千禧年管理公司（Millennium Management）正在迪拜组建一支新的投资团队，负责大宗商品市场的交易。【原文：Izzy Englander’s $79 billion Millennium Management is assembling a new investment team out of Dubai to trade across commodities markets, according to a person familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 米莱的 48 小时关税暂停引发农作物出口创纪录激增
item.description: 阿根廷总统哈维尔-米莱伊上周短暂暂停征收农作物出口关税，以支撑国家财政。大宗商品贸易商和农民目前正在努力应对这一后果。【原文：Argentine President Javier Milei’s brief pause on crop export tariffs last week, implemented to shore up the nation’s finances, sparked the biggest wave of bookings on record. Commodity traders and farmers are now grappling with the fallout.】

item.title: 美股走高，因看好人工智能发展势头和美联储宽松政策
item.description: 周五，美国股市走高，原因是人工智能押注和进一步降息预期刺激了风险上行势头。【原文：US stocks traded higher on Friday as risk-on momentum spurred by bets on artificial intelligence and expectations for further interest-rate cuts buoyed the market.】

item.title: 液化天然气项目势头强劲，莫桑比克债券收益率创 2022 年新低
item.description: 在埃尼公司（Eni SpA）批准了一项价值 72 亿美元的浮式液化天然气项目，以及道达尔能源公司（TotalEnergies SE）表示准备恢复该国北部大规模开发项目之后，莫桑比克 2031 年债券大涨。【原文：Mozambique’s 2031 bonds rallied after Eni SpA approved a $7.2 billion floating liquefied natural gas project and TotalEnergies SE signaled it’s ready to resume work on a massive development in the nation’s north.】

item.title: 苹果再添一熊，杰富瑞下调苹果评级，认为下行空间为 20
item.description: 周五，苹果公司获得了相对罕见的看跌分析师评级，杰富瑞（Jefferies）警告称，围绕客户升级 iPhone 的速度的预期已经过高。【原文：Apple Inc. received a relatively rare bearish analyst rating on Friday, as Jefferies warned that expectations surrounding how fast customers will upgrade their iPhones had become excessive.】

item.title: 特朗普威胁缓解，医药股迎来 16 年来的最佳一周
item.description: 由于与美国政府达成了药品定价和关税协议，缓解了今年大部分时间以来对医药行业的压力，医药股有望迎来 16 年来表现最好的一周。【原文：Pharmaceutical stocks are poised to cap off their best week in 16 years as a drug-pricing and tariff deal with the US government helped ease an overhang that’s been weighing on the sector for most of the year.】

item.title: 加拿大基金在美国关税和奚落声中押注 "国家建设
item.description: 加拿大的基金经理们正将筹码投向有望受益于加拿大总理马克-卡尼（Mark Carney）快速推进大型基础设施项目和减少对美国贸易依赖的计划的行业。【原文：Fund managers in Canada are pushing their chips into sectors expected to benefit from Prime Minister Mark Carney’s plan to fast-track major infrastructure projects and become less reliant on trade with the US.】

item.title: 古尔斯比称美联储处境艰难，就业与物价目标关系紧张
item.description: 芝加哥联邦储备银行行长古尔斯比（Austan Goolsbee）重申，在通胀和就业目标都面临压力的情况下，官员们应该谨慎地进行降息。【原文：Federal Reserve Bank of Chicago President Austan Goolsbee reiterated that officials should proceed carefully with rate cuts at a time when they are facing pressure to both their inflation and employment goals.】
